description: The presidential election in Zimbabwe last week that kept the governing party in power and was widely criticized as dubious is likely to isolate the country further from the United States and other Western nations. But it has also exposed Zimbabwe to increased scrutiny and pressure from a surprising place: its neighbors in southern Africa.

title: Leaderless and Exposed, Russias Wagner Faces an Uncertain Future
description: Its leader is officially dead, as is its founding commander. President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is claiming it doesnt exist.

title: Japan Scrubs Launch of X-Ray Telescope and Experimental Moon Lander
description: JAXA, the Japanese space agency, is gearing up to launch two very different space missions from one rocket: a new X-ray telescope that will spy on some of the hottest spots in our universe, and a small experimental robotic moon lander. But the missions will have to wait until another day to get off the ground.

title: Hailstorm in Germany Rips Through a Town, Damaging Buildings and Cars
description: An estimated 80 percent of buildings were damaged during a hailstorm in a town in southern Germany on Saturday, according to local authorities, leading officials to declare a state of emergency.

title: 11 Fatal Minutes That Have Jacksonville Confronting Racism Yet Again
description: In the span of 11 terrifying minutes, a gunman targeting Black people killed two shoppers and an employee at a Dollar General store in Jacksonville, Fla., a rampage that the authorities are investigating as a hate crime and that has reverberated through a community that has long coped with the legacy of racism.

title: Monday Briefing: Russia Confirmed Prigozhins Death
description: Russian investigators said yesterday that genetic tests showed that the Wagner private military group chief, Yevgeny Prigozhin, who led a brief mutiny against Moscows military leadership, was among the victims of a plane crash last week.

title: Haiti Gang Fires on Protest Called by Church Leader, Killing Several People
description: A gang vying for control of a swath of Haitis capital, Port-au-Prince, opened fire on Saturday on protesters organized by a church leader, killing at least seven people, human rights groups said. The shooting points to escalating violence around the city.

title: Jacksonville Sheriff Details Dollar General Shooting Chain of Events
description: Sheriff T.K. Waters of Jacksonville said that the gunman who killed three Black people at a Dollar General store had no criminal record and purchased his guns legally. Authorities are investigating the shooting as a hate crime.

title: Eagles Abode
description: Jump to: Todays Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Man Accused of Injecting Substance Into Neighbors Home Is Charged
description: A former chemistry student is facing multiple felony charges after a neighbor said he caught him on camera using a vial and syringe to insert an unknown substance through his condominium apartments door in Tampa, Fla.

title: Simone Biles Shows Shes Not Just Easing Her Way Back
description: By now, its canon that Simone Biles is the greatest gymnast of all time. The debate over that status largely ended years ago, when she began pushing the boundaries of whats possible in the sport.

title: Pastor Leads Followers Into Gunfire While Protesting Haiti Gangs
description: Pastor Marco, an evangelical church leader, told his followers that they were bulletproof as they marched against a gang on the outskirts of Port-au-Prince, a witness said.

title: In Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic Has a Much-Needed Gift: A Rival
description: Novak Djokovic had dominated all of the most significant moments of the first half of this tennis season. After winning his 10th Australian Open, he emerged with the Roland Garros crown, his 23rd Grand Slam tournament title, tied for the career record.

title: A 12,000-Year-Old Bird Call, Made of Bird Bones
description: In flight, the Eurasian kestrel is mostly silent, a small falcon that seems to defy physics as it faces the wind and hovers in midair, tail spread out like a fan. Flapping its wings vigorously, the bird of prey catches every eddy of the breeze while scanning the ground below for quarry.

title: A Field Guide to the 2023 U.S. Open
description: With the grass and clay seasons over, the eyes of the tennis world now turn to Flushing Meadows.

title: What Playing Forest Hills Means to Tennis Fans
description: Good morning. Today well look at the place where the precursor to the U.S. Open was played for more than 40 years. Also, the clock in front of Trump Tower that the city was slow to notice.

title: Monday Briefing
description: Wagner, the once-powerful Russian private military company that fell out of favor with the Kremlin after an aborted mutiny in June, has been cast into uncertainty. The Russian authorities have confirmed the death of the groups leader, Yevgeny Prigozhin, in a plane crash, and Russias president, Vladimir Putin, has sent mixed signals on his plans for Wagner.

title: A Fan Favorite Is Still Trying to Clear Her Major Hurdle
description: Seven weeks was not nearly enough time to soothe Ons Jabeurs emotional wounds. After losing the Wimbledon womens singles final in July, she returned home to Tunisia to put some space between her and another painful loss in a Grand Slam tournament final  the third in her career, all in the past 14 months.

title: Whats on TV This Week: Claim to Fame and Family Law
description: Between network, cable and streaming, the modern television landscape is a vast one. Here are some of the shows, specials and movies coming to TV this week, Aug. 28-Sept. 3. Details and times are subject to change.

title: Word of the Day: unseemly
description: The word unseemly has appeared in 44 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on June 14 in Spotted Lanternflies Are Back. You Should Still Kill Them by Asmaa Elkeurti:

title: Carlos Alcaraz Is Bending Tennis to His Will and Taking Over the Game
description: A little after 5 p.m. last Wednesday, Carlos Alcaraz, racket bag over his shoulders, bounded into the U.S. Open player garden outside Arthur Ashe Stadium like a high school quarterback striding into the cafeteria on the first day of school.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: MONDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Hearings Set for Monday in Two Election Cases Against Trump
description: By the end of Monday, another piece could be put in place in the complicated jigsaw puzzle of the four criminal cases facing former President Donald J. Trump: A date could be chosen for Mr. Trumps federal trial on charges of seeking to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Democrats Want to Flip N.Y. House Seats. But Theres a Primary Problem.
description: Sipping iced coffee at a diner the other day, Liz Whitmer Gereghty looked every bit the dream recruit Democrats need to recapture this coveted suburban House seat north of New York City.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This article contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: His Job Helping Drug Users Is Illegal. He Says He Does It to Save Lives.
description: During his afternoons at work, Bryan Ortiz wraps tourniquets around the arms of intravenous drug users to help them find a good vein. If asked, he will even insert the needle, and pull the plunger back, before letting the user push the drug in.

title: Lungs as Weve Never Published Them Before
description: Marlene Rodrguez used an inhaler to help her walk up the stairs. In his backyard, Andy Muoz hefted his oxygen machine onto his lap to sit on a swing beside his son. Tom Kennedy brought his machine to the golf course.

title: Theyre Forced to Run Online Scams. Their Captors Are Untouchable.
description: Around the world, reports of cyberscam schemes targeting unsuspecting victims online have proliferated rapidly. Southeast Asia has become a center of gravity for those criminal syndicates, often in remote and war-torn corners. But in Cambodia, the scam industry has been flourishing well within the reach of officials.

title: We Thought Wed Beat These Three Diseases, but Theyre Still Killing Us
description: There was a time not so long ago when preventing epidemic disease was a cause ordinary people embraced and celebrated. When President Franklin D. Roosevelt called on Americans to join the fight against polio, for instance, he reported that envelopes containing dimes and quarters and even dollar bills arrived by the truckload at the White House, from children who want to help other children to get well. The March of Dimes went on to fund the development of polio vaccines. When one of them, the Salk vaccine, proved effective, in April 1955, church bells rang out nationwide.

title: From Paris to the West Village, a Memoir of Privilege and Pain
description: Alice Carrires remarkable debut memoir, Everything/Nothing/Someone, is a timeless tale of surviving emotional neglect and mental illness; but it is also the story of a singular household filled with complex and exceptional artists, and the authors experience of inheriting their prodigious legacy. Carrires mother, Jennifer Bartlett (1941-2022), was an American conceptual artist renowned for her massive canvases that moved from mathematical abstraction into realism. One of the few artists able to live off their work in the 1970s and 80s, Bartlett became famous with her 1976 piece Rhapsody, a 153-foot-long series of steel plates and enamel inspired by New York City subway signs. In 1983, she married the authors father, Mathieu Carrire, a German intellectual, activist and actor whose first starring role was in Young Trless, directed by Volker Schlndorff.

title: Theres a Vast Source of Clean Energy Beneath Our Feet. And a Race to Tap It.
description: In a sagebrush valley full of wind turbines and solar panels in western Utah, Tim Latimer gazed up at a very different device he believes could be just as powerful for fighting climate change  maybe even more.

title: What Teaching History in Texas Looks Like
description: Much like in Florida, the fight over public education in Texas has become a lightning rod in the countrys culture wars. Seventh-grade social studies teachers, who teach a full year of Texas state history, are required to describe the defenders of the Alamo in a heroic light.

title: A Novelist Writing on Colonization Finds an Audience in France, at Last
description: For years, writing about Algeria, or even acknowledging Frances violent past there, was a lonely endeavor.

title: Raising Teens Is Hard. Lisa Damour Has Some Answers.
description: The author and psychologist Lisa Damour has become somewhat of a celebrity among many parents of teenagers.

title: Cant Sleep? Try This Proven Alternative to Medication.
description: About one in four adults in the United States develops symptoms of insomnia each year. In most cases, these are short-lived, caused by things like stress or illness. But one in 10 adults is estimated to have chronic insomnia, which means difficulty falling or staying asleep at least three times a week for three months or longer.

title: Electric Vehicle Charging Can Be Confusing. Heres What to Know.
description: With a push from Congress, automakers and charging companies are planning to install tens of thousands of fast chargers on American highways capable of refueling electric cars in half an hour or less.

title: Searching for Last-Minute Labor Day Plans? Try These Travel Tools.
description: With Labor Day weekend only days away, this hot and crowded summer is finally coming to an end  or at least, its unofficial end. But pulling off one last summer getaway, even last minute and over a holiday weekend, is still possible.

title: The Best True Crime to Stream: Leaving the United States
description: The true crime genre can often feel very America-centric: Crimes that take place in the United States, with American perpetrators, victims and investigators. So the systems at play  political, legal, cultural, press  are all anchored to a similar playbook, and the failures and successes of these systems can feel repetitive.

title: After the Sudden Heralding of Hilma af Klint, Questions and Court Fights
description: Her bold, colorful canvases in a Guggenheim Museum show rocked the art world in 2018  and filled a canyon in the popular imagination: Hilma af Klint, a largely unknown Swedish artist and mystic was discovered as an important pioneer of abstract painting.

title: How to Track a Songbird From Alaska to Peru
description: For an olive-sided flycatcher, migration can be a marathon. Some of the soot-colored songbirds travel more than 15,000 miles a year, winging their way from South America to Alaska and then back again. Its a dizzyingly long journey for a bird that weighs just over an ounce.

title: In Chicago, Keeping the Heritage of Black Dance Moving
description: On a warm July afternoon, Princess Mhoon, the director of the Chicago Black Dance Legacy Project, was sitting in a bustling cafe on the outskirts of the University of Chicagos campus in Hyde Park. Wearing a purple and orange dress that billowed around her arms, she gestured out of the window to show me where she went to high school  Kenwood Academy, not quite visible from where we sat, but less than two miles away.

title: How to Recognize a Tennis Prodigy
description: You may have seen it if youre a tennis fan. The ad begins with a young boy of 10 or 11, sitting in a humble apartment watching Venus Williams on a tiny antique television. Hes interrupted by a man tapping him on his shoulder.

title: To Escape the Heat in Dubai, Head to the Beach at Midnight
description: Toddlers squealed, the sea roared and a portable speaker abandoned on the shore played a love song. Perched on a giant inflatable hot dog, a child paddled through the shallows.

title: Not Over Yet: Late-Summer Covid Wave Brings Warning of More to Come
description: A late-summer wave of coronavirus infections has touched schools, workplaces and local government, as experts warn the public to brace for even more Covid-19 spread this fall and winter.

title: Theres a Good Chance Trump Will Be Found Willfully Blind
description: More than a decade ago, a divided Supreme Court ruled in United States v. Alvarez that an elected member of a district water board in California could not be prosecuted criminally for lying to an audience about winning the Medal of Honor. The court ruled that efforts to criminalize mere lying, without linking the lie to an attempt to gain a material advantage, posed an unacceptable threat to robust exercise of First Amendment rights.

title: The Thing Is, Most Republicans Really Like Trump
description: Much of what is happening in American politics today can be explained by two simple yet seemingly contradictory phenomena: Most partisans believe that the other side is more powerful than their own, while at the same time feeling quite certain that their own team will prevail in the upcoming election.

title: $4.2 Million Homes in California
description: This house is near the top of a winding street, just south of Griffith Park, in Los Feliz. It is five minutes by car from park attractions like the Griffith Observatory and the Greek Theatre, and about a mile from restaurants along Hillhurst Avenue, including an Italian cafe and a Brazilian-style cocktail bar.

title: A Fitting Final Gift From Jimmy Carter
description: When former President Jimmy Carter entered hospice care in February, many assumed that his death would be imminent, a matter of weeks at most. But six months later, he is still spending time with family and friends, still enjoying moments with his wife of nearly eight decades. Life continues, albeit under a shadow.

title: Dont Hate the Influencer Who Loves Her Big, Cheap Apartment. Wouldnt You?
description: Like many college graduates, Hattie Kolp needed two major things: a job and somewhere to live.

title: I Am in Love With Flowers That Are Ruined
description: How long can I stand at my window and watch the goldfinches, small flitting suns in their summer finery? For an hour I can stand there, hidden from wary eyes. For a joyful hour, for an entire joyful day, I can stand and watch the savage way they tear at my zinnias, yanking out petal after petal. They are searching for the seeds ripening at the end of each scrap of brightness. I am in love with the zinnias in their lopsided ruin, for they tell me the hungry goldfinches have had their fill.

title: Americans Still Put Their Trust in Juries. Will Trumps Trials Break That Faith?
description: At a time when trust in institutions is at an all-time low, Americans still seem to have faith in their fellow citizens serving on juries.

title: Are There Any Rules About Going Braless?
description: You are not the only one having an anti-bra moment. When many dressing mores went out the window during the pandemic lockdowns, the no-bra movement, which has resurfaced regularly since the 1960s, once again began picking up steam (led, in part, by Florence Pugh, above).

title: Frances Tiafoe Is Ready
description: One year ago, Frances Tiafoe headed to the U.S. Open, beloved within the tennis world but a relative unknown outside it. He emerged as the first American man to reach the U.S. Open semifinals since 2006, and the first Black American man since Arthur Ashe.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy Is Suddenly Part of Our Political Life
description: Gail Collins: Bret, we havent talked since the Republican debate. Cant say I fell in love with any of the contenders, but your fave, Nikki Haley, was certainly the most moderate voice onstage.

title: Todays Top News: A Makeshift Wagner Memorial in Moscow, and More
description: The New York Times Audio app is home to journalism and storytelling, and provides news, depth and serendipity. If you havent already, download it here  available to Times news subscribers on iOS  and sign up for our weekly newsletter.

title: A New Race to the Moon
description: Last week, India landed its spacecraft Chandrayaan-3 on the moon, becoming the first country to land such a craft near the south pole, where scientists believe vital reserves of water could be found frozen. The landing also revealed just how much the international space race has changed.

title: Children Have a Right to Sue Nations Over Climate, U.N. Panel Says
description: Young people around the world are increasingly taking their governments to court for failing to reduce climate pollution, and on rare occasions, they are winning.

title: Libyas Foreign Minister Flees Country Amid Uproar Over Meeting With Israeli
description: The Libyan foreign minister has fled to Turkey out of fear for her safety, Libyan officials said Monday, amid a growing uproar in their country over news that the minister met with her Israeli counterpart in Rome last week.

title: Cutting Health Care Costs
description: As his re-election effort gets underway, President Biden is signaling that health care  and particularly the cost of it  will be central to his campaign.

title: Bidens Commerce Chief Walks a Tightrope in China
description: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, one of the Biden administrations biggest Beijing hawks, kicked off her visit to China on Monday with a call to preserve a stable economic relationship between the two economic powers that share over $700 billion of trade.

title: Russia Charges Former U.S. Consulate Worker With Collecting Information About Ukraine War
description: Russias domestic security service said on Monday that a former employee of the U.S. Consulate in Vladivostok had been charged with illegally collecting information about the war in Ukraine and passing it to American officials.

title: Hundreds of Flights Into Britain Canceled After Technical Issue With U.K. Air Traffic Control
description: Airlines were forced to cancel hundreds of flights and delay hundreds more on Monday after Britains air traffic control service experienced a technical issue that caused widespread disruption on one of the countrys busiest travel days of the year.

title: Would Your Partner Cheat? These Testers Will Give You an Answer.
description: Caden Redmond, a college student in West Palm Beach, Fla., was on TikTok in April flirting with a woman living in South America. While writing to her via direct message, he told her he had never been to her home country but was planning a trip soon.

title: In Invasion, Simon Kinberg Adds Touchy-Feely to Creepy-Crawly
description: This interview includes spoilers for the Season 2 premiere of Invasion.

title: U.S. and China Agree to Broaden Talks in Bid to Ease Tensions
description: The United States and China agreed on Monday to hold regular conversations about commercial issues and restrictions on access to advanced technology, the latest step this summer toward reducing tensions between the worlds two largest economies.

title: Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic
description: This is Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic, a weekly review of the game that drives me out of my hive mind. In a good way. Sometimes. It is probably also worth mentioning that the Diary is a work of fiction.

title: How an Instagram Account Turned a Bay Area Community Against Itself
description: Its Monday. How a racist Instagram account turned a Bay Area community against itself. Plus, California is rethinking its future as its population stagnates.

title: After Prosecutors Open Inquiry Into Soccer Chief, He Is Asked to Resign
description: Spanish prosecutors said on Monday that they had opened an investigation into whether Luis Rubiales, the president of the countrys soccer federation, could be charged with committing an act of sexual aggression after he kissed one of the female teams players on the lips when they won the World Cup this month.

title: Do You Know the Real Names of These Authors?
description: Heres a short quiz that challenges you to match up five writers with their pen names.

title: Making the Playoffs Is Hard. Doing It Every Year Is Harder.
description: When the Phoenix Mercury lost to the Dallas Wings on Sunday, it ended an impressive period of sustained success. After a league-leading 10-year streak, the team will not be making the W.N.B.A. playoffs this season.

title: A Football Coach Walks the Line on C.T.E.
description: Football gave the University of Maryland Coach Michael Locksley a scholarship, a family and a career. But it also likely contributed to his sons C.T.E. diagnosis.

title: A Flexible, Fast Fish Recipe Thats a Total Wow
description: Hello! Welcome to the last week of August. I dont know where the month went, either.

title: After the Loss of a Son, a Football Coach Confronts a Terrible Truth
description: Michael Locksley was helping coach Alabama to a national championship in 2017 when his 25-year-old son, Meiko, was shot and killed.

title: Judge Sets Trial Date in March for Trumps Federal Election Case
description: A federal judge on Monday set a trial date of March 4 in the prosecution of former President Donald J. Trump on charges of conspiring to overturn the 2020 election, rebuffing Mr. Trumps proposal to push it off until 2026.

title: NATO Neighbors Demand Belarus Expel Wagner Fighters
description: Government officials from Poland, Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia demanded on Monday that Belarus expel the Russian mercenary group Wagner from its territory, amid heightened tensions related to Russias war in Ukraine.

title: Florida Officials Warn of Fuel Contamination as Idalia Approaches
description: Floridians face potentially widespread fuel contamination along the states Gulf Coast that could damage vehicles as Hurricane Idalia approaches and residents potentially face evacuation orders, state officials said a day after the governor declared a state of emergency for the storm.

title: Meadows Testifies in Bid to Move Georgia Trump Case to Federal Court
description: A battle over whether to move the Georgia racketeering case against Donald J. Trump and his allies to federal court began in earnest on Monday, when Mark Meadows, a former White House chief of staff, testified in favor of such a move before a federal judge in Atlanta.

title: Tell Us About How You Gather
description: Recent shifts in how we gather and spend our free time have affected how frequently we socialize with people inside and outside our households. But our desire to be together and the need for human connection remains unchanged. We want to hear about events and get-togethers across the country that bring people together to connect and play.

title: Searching for the Peoples Spelling Alphabet
description: Breakdowns in communication are a tale as old as biblical time. Come, let us go down and confuse their language so they will not understand each other, reads the story of the Tower of Babel in the Book of Genesis. So the Lord scattered them from there all over the earth, and they stopped building the city.

title: Waves Along Californias Coast Are Getting Bigger, Study Says
description: Early this year, severe storms battered California, bringing huge waves that damaged infrastructure and forced people away from the coast. That may be the new norm, as climate change fuels severe weather that is making waves bigger, according to a study published this month.

title: No Corrections: Aug. 28, 2023
description: Errors are corrected during the press run whenever possible, so some errors noted here may not have appeared in all editions.

title: Queer History Was Made in 90s Clubs. These Fliers Captured It.
description: In the new book Getting In, the journalist David Kennerley takes an electric visual stroll through New Yorks 1990s gay club scene. Not with photos, exactly, but through fliers  more than 200 of them  featuring polychromatic drag queens and come-hither hunks who enticed him to dance to Frankie Knuckles and Junior Vasquez remixes at popular nightclubs like Twilo and the Palladium, and parties like Jackie 60 and Lick It!

title: Tracking Tropical Storm Idalia
description: See the path and estimated wind arrival times for Idalia.

title: A Forced Kiss, and a Reckoning With Sexism in Spain
description: Laura Marqus has never been much interested in soccer. She doesnt watch the Spanish league games or know the names of the players. She didnt even watch the Spanish womens team win the World Cup final this month. But after the president of Spains soccer federation forcibly kissed one of the players during the medals ceremony, setting off a momentous national debate about feminism, equality and abuse, soccer is all she has been thinking about.

title: Man Killed by New Jersey Police Had Been Shot by Officers Once Before
description: Emergency workers had been called to the home of a 52-year-old man in Jersey City six times this month, according to local officials. During their seventh visit on Sunday, a responding police officer fatally shot him.

title: With Jacksonville and Idalia, DeSantis Faces Two Crises in Florida
description: For the first time since declaring his bid for the Republican nomination, Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida is facing a crisis in his home state.

title: U.S. Fines American Airlines $4.1 Million for Lengthy Tarmac Delays
description: The Transportation Department fined American Airlines $4.1 million on Monday, saying the carrier violated federal rules by keeping passengers stranded on airport tarmacs for hours on dozens of occasions in recent years.

title: France to Ban Full-Length Muslim Robes in Public Schools
description: France will bar children in public schools from wearing the abaya, a loosefitting, full-length robe worn by some Muslim women, the government said this week. It said the measure was necessary to stem a growing number of disputes in its secular school system.

title: Wheres Woke? Republicans Test a Different Education Message
description: Earlier this year, the Republican presidential primary looked as though it would be driven by conservative cultural battles, especially fights over education that had animated the partys base since the pandemic.

title: How Ozempic and Weight Loss Drugs Are Reshaping Denmarks Economy
description: After 100 years of relatively quiet existence as a maker of diabetes drugs, the Danish firm Novo Nordisk has suddenly grown so big that the company is reshaping the Danish economy.

title: Rich Men North of Richmond Repeats at No. 1
description: Rich Men North of Richmond, the out-of-nowhere viral protest song by Oliver Anthony Music, is the countrys No. 1 single for a second time, after playing a key role in last weeks Republican primary debate.

title: Samuel Wurzelbacher, Celebrated as Joe the Plumber, Dies at 49
description: Samuel Joseph Wurzelbacher, who briefly became Joe the Plumber, the metaphorical American middle-class Everyman, by injecting himself into the 2008 presidential campaign in an impromptu nationally-televised face-off with Barack Obama over taxing small businesses, died on Sunday at his home in Campbellsport, Wis., about 60 miles north of Milwaukee. He was 49.

title: Does Therapy Culture Help or Hurt Us?
description: To the Editor:

title: U.N.C. Faculty Member Is Fatally Shot in Lab
description: An assailant fatally shot a faculty member in a laboratory at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill on Monday, forcing the campus into lockdown for several hours as students barricaded themselves in classrooms, dorms and bathrooms, the authorities said.

title: Alexandra Paul, Olympic Figure Skater From Canada, Is Killed in Car Crash
description: Alexandra Paul, a figure skater from Canada who competed in the 2014 Olympic Games in Sochi, Russia, was killed in a car crash last week in which her infant son was injured, officials said.

title: Florence + the Machine Singer Says She Had Emergency Surgery
description: Florence Welch, the front woman of the English indie rock band Florence + the Machine, announced on Instagram that she had undergone emergency surgery, which is why she had canceled some of her recent shows.

title: The Scientist Who Foresaw Chinas Stagnation
description: Incongruously, Yi Fuxian, one of the worlds experts on Chinas demographic plight, specializes in pre-eclampsia  a complication of pregnancy  and works in Wisconsin. His day job is as a senior scientist in obstetrics and gynecology at the University of Wisconsin, Madison. In his native China, though, hes far better known for his off-hours specialty, which is warning the Chinese people about the serious consequences of their baby bust.

title: Flash Flooding in West Virginia Prompts Dozens of Rescues
description: Heavy rain and flash floods tore through parts of West Virginia on Monday morning, prompting emergency water rescues and evacuations, as residents were instructed to seek higher ground, the authorities said.

title: 18 New Restaurants to Put on Your Fall List
description: New restaurants open all year round in New York City, but fall arrives with the snap of fresh tablecloths, napkins and menus  and this year, several familiar names. Daniel Boulud, Jean-Georges Vongerichten, Andrew Carmellini and Marcus Samuelsson are among the star chefs with significant projects at hand. But a number of newcomers will also be worth checking out. In particular, autumn will usher in a compelling array of noteworthy Asian restaurants. Here are the openings Im most excited about:

title: Paid Late, or Never: Painters, Builders and Brokers Hit by Chinas Property Crisis
description: Once a beneficiary of Chinas property boom, Lan Mingqiang is now an unwitting casualty of its unraveling.

title: Zadie Smith Makes 1860s London Feel Alive, and Recognizable
description: All over the dorm in California glinted pale-orange and tabasco-red and steel-blue copies of Zadie Smiths White Teeth, with their hard white bright lettering. The year was 2001, and White Teeth had been assigned as incoming reading for my freshman dorm. I remember loving the sprawling, rude, funny, slapdash narration, the magical way in which Smith brought it all together in the figure of a genetically engineered mouse.

title: Skip the M&Ms Store and Head for The Fantastic World of the Portuguese Sardine
description: All gilded and ready to party, a new sardine store, The Fantastic World of the Portuguese Sardine, has opened in Times Square. Ovalor do Tempo, the company that owns Comur, an artisanal maker of Portuguese tinned fish since 1942, has many such stores in Portugal to promote the canned fish; this is their first in the United States. M&Ms in Times Square we understand, but sardines? For New York, tuna would be more like it. Though the company cans that fish, too, theyre known for their sardines, which come skinless and boneless, or not, and with flavors like lemon and hot pepper. All are packed in extra virgin olive oil. Stacked floor to ceiling on two levels, the colorful tins are for sale, about $13 and up. And for gift-giving there are commemorative tins marked with various years stretching back (though recently canned), and even a goldtone one for $44. Other varieties of seafood in tins like cod and octopus are coming.

title: Jamila Robinson Is Named Next Editor of Bon Apptit Magazine
description: Jamila Robinson, a top editor at The Philadelphia Inquirer, will be the next editor in chief of the food magazine Bon Apptit.

title: Tuesday Briefing: U.S. and China Agree to Broaden Talks
description: During her visit to Beijing, Gina Raimondo, the U.S. commerce secretary, said the U.S. and China had agreed to hold regular discussions about certain economic issues  the latest step toward reducing tensions between the worlds two largest economies.

title: Don Sundquist, Two-Term Tennessee Governor, Is Dead at 87
description: Don Sundquist, a Republican who was twice elected governor of Tennessee and earlier served 12 years in the United States House of Representatives, died on Sunday in Memphis. He was 87.

title: The popes praise for Russias historic empire draws sharp criticism.
description: In comments made by video to Catholic youth in St. Petersburg, Russia, on Friday, Pope Francis praised 18th-century Russian rulers and the Great Russia they helped create  an empire that President Vladimir V. Putin has invoked in framing his invasion of Ukraine.

title: A New Trial Date. A New Primary Season.
description: This isnt shaping up to be your usual presidential primary.

title: In a Bitter Lawsuit, Chess Combatants Agree to a Draw
description: A $100 million defamation lawsuit filed against the five-time world chess champion Magnus Carlsen, a top chess streamer and the worlds largest chess site has been settled.

title: America Is Using Up Its Groundwater Like Theres No Tomorrow
description: Unchecked overuse is draining and damaging aquifers nationwide, a data investigation by the New York Times revealed, threatening millions of people and Americas status as a food superpower.

title: Paul Whelan, American Imprisoned in Russia, Is Seen in New Video
description: Paul Whelan, an American imprisoned in Russia, appeared in a video released on Monday by a Kremlin-backed news network, giving his family a chance to see him for the first time in three years.

title: 3 Hosts of an Eric Adams Fund-Raiser Are Said to Face Indictment
description: A few months before he was elected mayor of New York City, Eric Adams was feted at a $1,000-a-head fund-raiser at Russos on the Bay, a plush wedding venue overlooking the water in Howard Beach, Queens. Among the hosts was Eric Ulrich, a city councilman whom Mr. Adams would eventually appoint as buildings commissioner.

title: 4 Are Found Dead in Upper West Side Apartment, Including 2 Children
description: The bodies of four family members, including a toddler and a baby, were found on Monday inside a locked Upper West Side apartment in what police were investigating as an attack involving at least three knives.

title: Rescue Helicopter Crashes Into Florida Apartment Building, Killing 2
description: A rescue helicopter that was experiencing mechanical trouble caught fire and crashed into an apartment building in Pompano Beach, Fla., on Monday morning, killing two people and injuring four others, the authorities said.

title: A Judge Rejected Trumps Efforts to Delay His Federal Jan. 6 Trial
description: At a hearing today in Washington, the judge overseeing the federal prosecution of Donald Trump on charges of conspiring to overturn the 2020 election said that the trial would start on March 4.

title: Nicholas Hitchon, Who Aged 7 Years at a Time in Up Films, Dies at 65
description: Nicholas Hitchon, whose life was chronicled in the acclaimed Up series of British documentaries, beginning when he was a boy in the English countryside in 1964 and continuing through the decades as he grew to become a researcher and professor at the University of Wisconsin, died on July 23 in Madison, Wis. He was 65.

title: Madison Square Garden Given Shortest Ever Permit by Council Committees
description: Madison Square Garden, which bills itself as the worlds most famous arena, appears to have lost its bid to operate in perpetuity on top of Pennsylvania Station in Manhattan.

title: Pentagon Vows to Move Quickly to Buy More Drones, Citing China Threat
description: The Pentagon announced on Monday that it would buy thousands of unmanned drones and other autonomous devices over the next two years, adding that it had been far too slow to embrace new technology that is small, smart, cheap and that could bolster the U.S. military as it prepares for possible future conflict with China.

title: California Attorney General Seeks to Block Transgender Notification Policy
description: Californias attorney general, Rob Bonta, filed a lawsuit against a Southern California school district on Monday, asking a judge to halt a new requirement that parents be notified when their child changes pronouns or gender identity.

title: GWS-BRITNEY-SPEARS
Quotation of the Day: An Inside Look at Covids Lasting Damage to the Lungs
description: These lungs are not capable of sustaining life.

title: Patti LuPone Sings for the LuPonettes
description: Last weekend on Fire Island in New York, far from the bright lights of Broadway, Patti LuPone performed at the Ice Palace nightclub for some of her most adoring fans. These die-hards, sometimes called LuPonettes, included a man who had seen Ms. LuPone in the 1979 production of Evita and another who had a caricature of her tattooed on his back.

title: Biden Administration Questions New Yorks Handling of Migrant Crisis
description: For months, as thousands of migrants seeking asylum have arrived in New York City, local officials have pleaded for Washington to intervene, urging the White House to help stem a spiraling humanitarian crisis that has strained city resources.

title: Eminem Tells Vivek Ramaswamy to Stop Rapping His Songs
description: As it turned out, Vivek Ramaswamy only got one shot to lose himself in the music.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy Is Very Annoying. Its Why Hes Surging in the Polls.
description: Of all the descriptors attached to Vivek Ramaswamy, the 38-year-old political tyro enjoying a bizarre surge in the Republican primary race for second place, the most common one seems to be annoying. After the Republican presidential primary debate on Wednesday, a Politico headline quoted a party strategist about Ramaswamys performance: It just got to be annoying. In a widely shared essay, the writer Josh Barro, a Harvard contemporary of Ramaswamy, probed the quality that makes Vivek so annoying. CNNs S.E. Cupp called him, in a column: Obnoxious. Annoying. Disrespectful. Inexperienced. Conspiratorial.

title: The Paranoid Style in American Plutocrats
description: Recently Dr. Peter Hotez, a leading vaccine scientist and a frequent target of anti-vaxxer harassment, expressed some puzzlement in a post on X, formerly Twitter. He noted that many of those taunting him were also big time into bitcoin or cryptocurrency and declared that I cant quite connect the dots on that one.

title: Ukraine Says It Retook a Village, a Win That Highlights the Rough Going
description: Ukraines military said on Monday that its forces had retaken the southern village of Robotyne, a tactical victory that underlines the immense challenge Kyivs counteroffensive faces in punching through deep and dense Russian defenses.

title: After Maui Wildfire Disaster, a War of Words Over Its Cause
description: Even before the inferno that engulfed the Maui resort of Lahaina is fully contained, local officials and Hawaiis leading utility are at odds over a fundamental question: Did a single fire break out in the hills overlooking the town on the fateful day, or were there two?

title: Tech Chiefs to Gather in Washington Next Month on A.I. Regulations
description: Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, plans to kick off a series of listening sessions next month on the regulation of artificial intelligence with Elon Musk of Tesla, Sundar Pichai of Google, Sam Altman of OpenAI and Satya Nadella of Microsoft.

title: At the U.S. Open, Frances Tiafoe Picks Up Where He Left Off
description: The last time Frances Tiafoe was playing a match inside Arthur Ashe Stadium, it was under the lights last year in front of a teeming crowd of 23,000, roaring with every point, as he tried to topple Carlos Alcaraz, the eventual U.S. Open champion and No. 1, in the semifinals.

title: President of Powerful Realtors Group Resigns After Sexual Harassment Claims
description: The president of the powerful National Association of Realtors has resigned, two days after The New York Times published an article detailing complaints from women that he exhibited a pattern of behavior that included improper touching and sending lewd photos and texts.

title: Bowling Locale
description: Jump to: Todays Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Grief and Anger Continue to Reverberate From Jacksonville Shootings
description: Two days after a gunman killed three Black people at a Dollar General store in Jacksonville, Fla., in a racially motivated attack, and as grief and anger reverberated through the community, new details about the gunmans writings and the timeline of events continued to emerge.

title: No Place for Hate in America, Haley Says, Recalling 2015 Church Massacre
description: Breaking from her usual stump speech at a South Carolina town hall event on Monday, Nikki Haley paused to condemn a deadly weekend rampage in Jacksonville, Fla., that the authorities were investigating as a hate crime.

title: Tennessee G.O.P. Again Silences Democratic Lawmaker Justin Jones
description: Tennessees House Republicans on Monday again silenced Representative Justin Jones, a Black Democrat who was expelled earlier this year in a gun control protest, after he was deemed to have violated new stringent rules of decorum.

title: Quotation of the Day: Trial for Trump Is Set for March in Federal Case
description: Mr. Trump, like any defendant, will have to make the trial date work regardless of his schedule.

title: Corrections: Aug. 29, 2023
description: Because of an editing error, an article on Friday about a conflict between the maker of a Bella Abzug documentary and Ms. Abzugs daughter attributed an erroneous distinction to Ms. Abzugs service in Congress. The first Jewish congresswoman was Florence Prag Kahn, not Ms. Abzug.

title: Past Drones and Sea Mines, a Merchant Ships Perilous Journey in Ukraine
description: For five weeks, almost everything seemed to go wrong for one commercial vessel waiting in the Danube River to load Ukrainian grain bound for Spain via the Black Sea.

title: TikToks U.S. Future Still in Limbo as Commerce Secretary Visits China
description: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondos visit to China is putting a spotlight on the future of TikTok in the United States, where criticism of the app and its ties to Beijing reached a fever pitch this year.

title: She Rose From Poverty as China Prospered. Then It Made Her Poor Again.
description: Two years ago, as she walked through a hospital hallway in handcuffs and shackles to get tested for Covid, Sun Junli felt ashamed and defeated. At 45, she had come a long way. The poor village girl in northwestern China had become a successful businesswoman.

title: Venice Film Festival 2023: What to Watch For
description: A year ago, the Venice Film Festival had enough star power to put even celebrity-worshiping Cannes on notice. Highlights were quickly beamed all over the world, including the notorious Dont Worry Darling kickoff that fueled endless speculation about the films director, Olivia Wilde, and her stars Florence Pugh and Harry Styles; the news conference where an unexpectedly sagacious Timothe Chalamet predicted imminent societal collapse; and the tearful Brendan Fraser comeback that began on the Lido and culminated in his best actor Oscar win.

title: Underground Art: A Show Celebrates Subway Posters
description: Good morning. Today well look at an exhibition of posters that were originally on the walls of subway stations. For the next two months, theyll be on the walls of an art gallery. Well also find out about birds that are passing through New York on the way south.

title: Tuesday Briefing
description: A federal judge has set a trial date of March 4 in the prosecution of Donald Trump on charges that he conspired to overturn the 2020 election, rebuffing the former presidents proposal to postpone the trial until 2026. It was an early victory for prosecutors, who had asked for a Jan. 2 date.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: TUESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This article contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: For Migrating Birds, Its the Flight of Their Lives
description: Many of the birds that spend their summers in the United States are preparing to fly south. Heres where theyre headed  and why it matters.

title: In a Decaying Queens Fortress, Its One Man Versus 47 Kinds of Mosquito
description: In a damp, dungeonlike cell beneath a crumbling military fortress in northeast Queens, Dr. Waheed Bajwa and his team were counting sleeping mosquitoes and trying to divine the future.

title: A Toddlers Long, Slow Road to Recovery After a Shooting
description: It was story time. A pair of 2-year-olds sat on miniature chairs pulled up to a miniature table at Blythedale Childrens Hospital in Valhalla, N.Y., listening attentively.

title: Denver Settles With Black Lives Matter Protesters for $4.7 Million
description: The authorities in Denver approved a $4.7 million settlement on Monday for more than 300 protesters who were detained for violating an emergency curfew during demonstrations over the killing of George Floyd in 2020, and later accused the police of using excessive force.

title: U.S. Does Not Want to Decouple From China, Commerce Chief Says
description: Gina Raimondo, the U.S. secretary of commerce, told Chinese officials on Tuesday that the United States was not seeking to sever economic ties with China, but she expressed a litany of concerns that were prompting the business community to describe China as uninvestable.

title: Chinas Economic Outlook: Pep Talks Up Top, Gloom on the Ground
description: To the residents and business owners of Chedun, a working-class neighborhood in the southwestern outskirts of Shanghai, the signs of an anemic economy are all around. The factories that once drew workers from around the country have moved away. Those that remain have slashed wages. Around the affordable eateries and motley shops where workers once crowded, employees eagerly latch onto anyone passing by.

title: Imran Khans 3-Year Sentence Is Suspended by Pakistan Appeals Court
description: An appeals court in Pakistan suspended former Prime Minister Imran Khans three-year prison sentence on Tuesday, the latest twist in a political showdown between Mr. Khan and leaders of the powerful military establishment who appear intent on sidelining him from politics.

title: We Benefited From Legacy Admissions. And We Want It to End.
description: Five legacy students wrestle with the advantages they had in the college admissions process.

title: Its Time to Talk About Pandemic Revisionism
description: Should schools have been closed down? Were lockdowns a mistake? Was masking even effective? Was the economic stimulus too big?

title: Does Blending Fruit in a Smoothie Affect Its Nutrients?
description: Q: If I blend fruits and vegetables into a smoothie, do they lose nutrients or fiber?

title: Biden Looks for New Ways to Energize Black Voters
description: During a recent town hall with the Congressional Black Caucus, Vice President Kamala Harris offered a gut check to the 200 people who had gathered to take stock of the state of civil rights in America.

title: In Hilary Leichters Multiverse, Your Dream Life Is Always on Deck
description: Priced out of their first home in an unnamed city, a young couple and their infant daughter, Rose, move into a smaller apartment. Its dark and confined, the amicable kind of cramped. When Edward shows it to his wife, Annie, for the first time, he says, Give it some time, it might grow on you! She replies, You mean it might literally grow?

title: The A.I. Revolution Is Coming. But Not as Fast as Some People Think.
description: Lori Beer, the global chief information officer of JPMorgan Chase, talks about the latest artificial intelligence with the enthusiasm of a convert. She refers to A.I. chatbots like ChatGPT, with its ability to produce everything from poetry to computer programs, as transformative and a paradigm shift.

title: Why Is the Reputation of the U.S. Military Going South So Fast?
description: In the years and months since the U.S. withdrawals from Iraq and Afghanistan, public respect for our armed forces has been plummeting toward levels not seen since the end of the American war in Vietnam.

title: Wait, Is That Rapid Test Really Expired?
description: Since the public health emergency expired, lab P.C.R. tests  the gold standard for detecting Covid-19  have become more expensive and less accessible for many people. That largely leaves us with at-home rapid tests. As cases climb in some areas and reinfections crop up, heres a refresher on how to use the tests most effectively.

title: At Home With Marcia Gay Harden
description: The actress found a place to plant roots on a 300-acre estate in the Catskills: We just saw so much incredible nature here.

title: The Mountain Will Make Cowards Out of All of Us
description: Nate Boyer looked up as he began his ascent of Hope Pass about 40 miles into the Leadville Trail 100-mile race. The four-mile section rose 3,200 feet in elevation, taking runners to 12,600 feet above sea level. He would have to conquer the steep grade, run seven miles down the other side to a turnaround and repeat the process. The sun beat down as he maneuvered the trail, devoid of any shade.

title: Its Affirmative Action for the Rich. Five Legacy Students Spoke to Us About Their Privilege.
description: A lot of people have recently weighed in on legacy admissions, the preferential treatment given to the children of alumni in the college application process: President Biden. Members of Congress. Supreme Court justices. Officials at numerous colleges  some defending the practice, others calling to ditch it.

title: Why Marcia Gay Harden Spends Her Time Off in Upstate New York
description: Zooming around on an ATV at her property in the Catskills, a couple of hours north of New York City, Marcia Gay Harden pointed out various sights that sparked memories: a back road where she taught her children how to drive; a garden where they picked blueberries; a skate ramp one of her children built; the forsythia trees she planted in honor of her mother, who died in 2018.

title: The Only Thing That Helps Me Be in the Moment
description: Earlier this year, Paul Simons Me and Julio Down by the Schoolyard came on at a party I was at. I didnt recognize the song at first; the room was crowded, and making out Simons strumming over multiple streams of chatter and conversation proved difficult. But then I heard it: a sharp noise, cutting through the tracks major chords in jagged intervals like a pair of blunt scissors. When I asked my friend what she thought the sound was, she paused, then guessed it might have been a duck. Another friend likened it to throat singing. They didnt expect that the alien noise came from a type of drum  the cuca.

title: Portugal Has Succeeded Where Weve Failed With Addiction
description: After Cody Bohanan, 24, was locked up on a charge related to possession of drug paraphernalia in 2021, he told the staff at Butler County Jail in Ohio that he was withdrawing from opioids. His cellmates saw him vomiting blood. They implored guards to intervene.

title: How to Go Camping: A Beginners Guide
description: For first-time campers, spending the night outside presents a planning wilderness, including figuring out what to bring. The following are tips from experts in getting started.

title: Japan Rail Pass, One of Travels Great Deals, Gets Pricier
description: Since 1981, the Japan Rail Pass has provided overseas visitors with budget-friendly access to unlimited rides on the countrys local and regional lines, as well as the famed shinkansen bullet trains, which can reach an operational speed of 200 miles per hour, at prices unchanged in decades. Indeed, visitors to Japan in 2023 pay the same unadjusted amount for a two-week rail pass as they did in 1989.

title: How Trumps Election Lies Left the Michigan G.O.P. Broken and Battered
description: The Michigan Republican Party is starving for cash. A group of prominent activists  including a former statewide candidate  was hit this month with felony charges connected to a bizarre plot to hijack election machines. And in the face of these troubles, suspicion and infighting have been running high. A recent state committee meeting led to a fistfight, a spinal injury and a pair of shattered dentures.

title: What Fani Willis Got Wrong in Her Trump Indictment
description: By assembling a sprawling, 19-defendant RICO indictment with 41 counts, District Attorney Fani Willis of Fulton County has brought the sort of charging instrument that has typically led to monthslong trials, complicated appeals and exhaustion for the participating attorneys. Now, as some co-defendants seek federal removal while others demand speedy trials in state court, we are starting to see the costs of complexity.

title: Giulianis Upper East Side Apartment Is for Sale
description: Apartment 10W at 45 East 66th Street went up for sale for $6.5 million in July. The prewar apartment includes an abundance of sunshine, high ceilings, and beautiful hardwood floors, according to the listing. The layout is thoughtful and inviting. The dining room is ideal for a tranquil breakfast or cozy dinner. Oh, and pets are welcome in this co-op building.

title: An American Tragedy at the Dollar General
description: When I was a child, I loved going to the Dollar General. It was the one place I could pick out any toy I wanted, confident that my mother wouldnt turn me down because it was too expensive.

title: An Effort to Focus on Long Overlooked Roma Suffering in the Holocaust
description: Before the Second World War, Helena Malkov grew up in Uhersk Hradit, a town in Czechoslovakia, where her family lived with other Roma in a settlement of old freight wagons lined up behind a sugar factory, near the Morava River.

title: The Forgotten Radicalism of the March on Washington
description: As remembered and commemorated by most Americans, the 1963 March on Washington  its 60th anniversary fell on Monday  represents the essence of the civil rights movement, defined in our national mythology as a colorblind demand for neutrality and fairness in the face of discrimination, embodied in the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.s dream that his four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.

title: How the War in Ukraine Turned Tennis Into a Battlefield
description: It was a few days before the start of Wimbledon this summer, and Elina Svitolina, just off a flight from Geneva, had come to the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club to check in for the tournament. She was returning after a years absence. It feels like it has been 10 years, she said as she got out of the car. A lot had happened since she last competed at Wimbledon, in 2021. She had given birth to a daughter named Ska, the first child for her and her husband, the French player Gal Monfils. Also, her country, Ukraine, had been invaded by Russia.

title: Hurricane Idalia: Floridas Evacuation Orders by County
description: As Hurricane Idalia approaches, at least 30 counties in western and Central Florida have issued evacuation orders, including parts of Tampa, the states third-largest city.

title: Todays Top News: Trump Gets a Trial Date, and More
description: The New York Times Audio app is home to journalism and storytelling, and provides news, depth and serendipity. If you havent already, download it here  available to Times news subscribers on iOS  and sign up for our weekly newsletter.

title: A Marriage, a Secret and a Crackdown in China
description: Over the past decade, China has placed more and more restrictions on the lives of its citizens  tightening its hold over what people can do, read and say.

title: Knocked Off Their Perch, the Rangers Hope to Climb Back Up
description: This is the first season in Major League Baseballs modern era in which all teams play each other. Its about time, really, an easy way to boost the national appeal of a sport that skews regional. Yet some of the matchups still seem a little strange.

title: Hot Ocean Temperatures Could Give Hurricane Idalia a Boost
description: As Hurricane Idalia charges toward Florida, one factor that could amplify its effects on coastal communities is the unusually warm water in the Gulf of Mexico, which is partly the result of the sultry weather that has been smothering the South all summer.

title: Uncharted Waters
description: The water that lies beneath the earths surface  known as groundwater  has been a vital resource for thousands of years. Communities that are far away from lakes and rivers use groundwater to irrigate crops and provide drinking water.

title: Five Takeaways From Our Investigation Into Americas Groundwater Crisis
description: A New York Times investigation has found that America is depleting its invaluable reserves of groundwater at a dangerous rate.

title: U.K. Air Travel Will Be Disrupted for Some Days After Traffic Control Glitch
description: Flights in and out of Britain will be disrupted for days, the U.K. government said on Tuesday, after a technical issue with the countrys air traffic control system left thousands of passengers stranded abroad or facing severe delays.

title: Wagner Says Its Chief Has Been Buried, Ending Days of Speculation
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, the Russian mercenary chief who died in a plane crash last week, has been buried in a private ceremony in St. Petersburg, his press service said on Tuesday, ending days of speculation over how he would be laid to rest.

title: 3M Says It Will Pay $6 Billion to Resolve Combat Earplug Lawsuits
description: 3M, the chemical and manufacturing giant, said on Tuesday that it had reached a $6 billion settlement over claims that it sold defective combat earplugs to the U.S. military.

title: C.E.O.s Side With New York in the Migrant Crisis
description: As New York Citys migrant crisis continues to escalate, with more than 100,000 arrivals from the southern U.S. border straining shelters, some of the citys top business leaders are intervening in a fight over whos responsible.

title: U.S. Announces First Drugs Picked for Medicare Price Negotiations
description: The Biden administration on Tuesday unveiled a long-awaited list of the first 10 medicines that will be subject to price negotiations with Medicare, kicking off a landmark program to reduce drug spending that is being fought by the pharmaceutical industry in court.

title: Metas Biggest Single Takedown Removes Chinese Influence Campaign
description: On Feb. 27, an article claiming that the United States was behind the bombing of the Nord Stream underwater pipelines in the Baltic Sea was published on the Substack and Blogspot blogging platforms.

title: Preyed On by Gangs: Gun Violence Surges Within Israels Arab Communities
description: When the shots rang out, the young soccer player was in line at a butchers shop in an Arab town in northern Israel. Struck in his leg, he tried to flee, he said. But a black-clad masked gunman chased him, firing into his legs at point-blank range, smashing bones, crushing muscle and severing blood vessels.

title: Luis Rubiales and Spains Kiss Scandal at the World Cup, Explained
description: When the Spanish womens national soccer team won the World Cup final this month, their compatriots had little time to celebrate before the behavior of the countrys top soccer official prompted a controversy over misogyny and sexual assault.

title: California Tries Paying Drug Users to Stay Sober
description: California began a bold experiment this year: paying people to stay sober.

title: Georgia School District Canceled an Authors Talks After He Said Gay
description: The principal of a Georgia elementary school apologized to parents last week after a guest author who was discussing his research into a co-creator of Batman told a group of fifth graders that the co-creators son was gay.

title: Water Main Break in Midtown Manhattan Floods Subway System
description: A 120-year-old water main in Times Square burst early Tuesday morning, sending an estimated 1.8 million gallons of water flooding into the subway system and upending the morning commute, officials said.

title: At a Rejuvenated Stratford, Second Chances for Plays and Theaters
description: Its a joyful thing when a great play that seemed to be lost is found. How much more so when its greatness is confirmed and the play takes root in the soil of a new time.

title: Is It Time to Wear a Mask Again?
description: As new Covid variants gain traction, reinfections become more common and cases climb in certain areas, a few schools and businesses are reinstating mask requirements. Experts say it makes sense to increase precautions, including turning back to masks.

title: The Best Mango Lassi Recipe
Job Openings Dropped in July as Labor Market Cooled
description: The number of job openings continued to drop in July, the Labor Department reported Tuesday, another sign that the U.S. labor market is losing its momentum.

title: Vatican Tries to Clarify Pope Francis Remarks on Russia
description: Pope Francis did not intend to glorify imperialistic logic in off-the-cuff remarks last week about expansionist 18th-century Russian rulers, the Vatican said on Tuesday, seeking to calm an outcry over comments that some critics said were too close to President Vladimir V. Putins justifications for invading Ukraine.

title: Pressure Mounts on Spanish Soccer Chief Over Nonconsensual Kiss at World Cup
description: The pressure is growing on Luis Rubiales, president of Spains national soccer federation, to quit, nine days after he forcibly kissed a member of the countrys victorious womens World Cup team, igniting a national controversy over sexism in soccer and prompting calls for his resignation from government ministers.

title: Factories May Be Leaving China, but Trade Ties Are Stronger Than They Seem
description: The United States has spent the past five years pushing to reduce its reliance on China for computer chips, solar panels and various consumer imports amid growing concern over Beijings security threats, human rights record and dominance of critical industries.

title: Our Best Gazpacho Recipe
Ginger Chicken With Peanut Sauce, Coconut Rice With Shrimp and Corn
description: We recently published a collection of the 50 most popular recipes of the year so far on New York Times Cooking. If nothing else, I hope it reminds you to make our furikake tomato sandwiches while supplies last (and by that I mean audaciously juicy summer tomatoes), and that there are few pleasures more pure than plunging deep into a bowl of Magnolia Bakery banana pudding.

title: As Teens Take to E-Bikes, Parents Ask: Is This Freedom or Danger?
description: With e-bikes soaring in popularity, regulators have been unable to keep up with the quickly-evolving market. Safety and law enforcement officials note that many models marketed to children and teenagers exceed legal speed limits and more closely resemble motor vehicles, which require a license and registration to operate.

title: So Youre Done With Suits
description: For reasons no one can quite decipher, the legal soap Suits, which aired on USA from 2011-2019, has become the show of the summer. While it was popular enough when it aired, Ive read more Suits articles in the last few weeks than during the shows entire run.

title: After Florida, Idalia Will Move Through the Southeast
description: After making landfall early Wednesday in Floridas Big Bend region, Hurricane Idalia was expected to move quickly inland and threaten other parts of the Southeast, taking a path along the Atlantic coast late Wednesday and Thursday. Forecasters issued a hurricane warning for coastal communities in Georgia and South Carolina.

title: Cannabis Use Disorder Is Common Among Marijuana Users, Study Finds
description: More than one-fifth of people who use cannabis struggle with dependency or problematic use, according to a study published on Tuesday in The Journal of the American Medical Association Network Open.

title: Hurricane Idalia Is Aiming for Floridas Big Bend Region
description: Hurricane Idalia is expected to make landfall early Wednesday along Floridas Big Bend, a marshy coast of sparsely populated wetlands known for its freshwater springs and tiny fishing villages  including Cedar Key, a conglomeration of tiny islands connected by small bridges, where a deadly storm struck in 1896 and killed at least 70 people in Florida.

title: Hes Worked a Lot of Odd Jobs, and Has the Poems to Prove It
description: In literature as in life, hating your job is an American tradition.

title: Word of the Day: anthropomorphize
description: The word anthropomorphize has appeared in 13 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Aug. 11 in A Chimp Sanctuary With a New Urgency to Give Shelter by Emmett Lindner, an interview with Emily Anthes:

title: Hitting Theater Hard: The Loss of Subscribers Who Went to Everything
description: As a group of stagehands assembled train cars for the set of Murder on the Orient Express, Ken Martin looked grimly at his email. His first year as artistic director at the Clarence Brown Theater in Knoxville, Tenn., was coming to an end, and the theater had missed its income goals by several hundred thousand dollars, largely because it had lost about half its subscribers since the start of the pandemic.

title: Scalise, No. 2 House Republican, Says He Has Blood Cancer
description: Representative Steve Scalise, Republican of Louisiana and the majority leader, said Tuesday he had been diagnosed with a rare form of blood cancer but planned to return to Washington to continue working as he undergoes treatment over the next several months.

title: One Piece Creator Hopes to Defy a History of Failure
description: On Thursday, an eight-part adaptation of Eiichiro Odas pirate comedy-adventure One Piece will make its Netflix debut. The stakes are high: Millions of fans want to see if the showrunners, Matt Owens and Steven Maeda (whom Oda describes as One Piece superfans), succeeded in converting the beloved manga and anime series to live-action. Although some viewers over 30 may not recognize the title, One Piece is one of the most popular entertainment franchises in the world.

title: Biden Discusses Migration With the President of Costa Rica
description: President Biden hosted President Rodrigo Chaves of Costa Rica at the White House on Tuesday as their countries try to rein in a surge of migration in the Western Hemisphere.

title: I Struggled to Understand the Concept of Love: The Week 10 Winner of Our Summer Reading Contest
description: Our Summer Reading Contest is our longest-running challenge and perhaps our simplest: To participate, all you have to do is answer the question, What got your attention in The Times this week?

title: Pat Corrales, Manager of Three Major League Teams, Dies at 82
description: Pat Corrales, who managed the Texas Rangers, Cleveland Indians and Philadelphia Phillies before a long stint on the Atlanta Braves coaching staff under the Hall of Fame skipper Bobby Cox, died on Sunday at his home in the north Georgia mountains. The first Major League manager of Mexican descent, he was 82.

title: Hurricane Idalia Threatens to Stir Up Lake Okeechobees Toxic Algae Blooms
description: For much of the summer, Lake Okeechobee suffocates under toxic, blue-green algae blooms fed by fertilizer runoff from farms. The blooms recently subsided, but Hurricane Idalia could cause further cycles of growth and rot.

title: Totem Pole Taken 94 Years Ago Begins 4,000-Mile Journey Home
description: Almost 100 years ago, a hand-carved totem pole was cut down in the Nass Valley in the northwest of Canadas British Columbia.

title: How to Handle Flight Delays and Cancellations
description: With weather being one of the leading causes of air travel delays this year, heres how to prepare for delays or cancellations during hurricane season.

title: Francis Suarez Drops Out of the G.O.P. Presidential Race
description: Mayor Francis X. Suarez of Miami dropped out of the race for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination on Tuesday, after failing to gain traction in a crowded field and falling short of the requirements to participate in the first Republican debate.

title: U.N.C. Graduate Student Is Charged in Fatal Shooting of Professor
description: A graduate student at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill has been charged in the fatal shooting of one of his professors on Monday, a killing that spread fear across the campus and forced an hourslong lockdown, according to court documents.

title: With Feud Over, New Womens Ice Hockey League Is Set to Begin
description: With a long-running feud in womens professional ice hockey now settled, a new league with many of the worlds best players is ready to push forward in January, and its inaugural home cities and other details were announced on Tuesday.

title: A Summer of Live Music, From Stadiums to Clubs
description: I sincerely hope I am not the first person to break this news to you, but its true: Summer is almost over.

title: Trucks, Cars, Bikes Battling for Space on City Streets
description: To the Editor:

title: The Dangerous Marketing of the Trump Mug Shot
description: After the mug shot, the marketing.

title: Bitcoin Jumps as Court Ruling Paves Way for Cryptocurrency E.T.F.
description: Cryptocurrency prices jumped on Tuesday after the industrys largest fund manager scored a legal victory in its long-running attempt to make it easier for investors to put Bitcoin in their portfolios.

title: Transcript: David Wallace-Wells Interviews Katelyn Jetelina
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode, guest-hosted by David Wallace-Wells, with Katelyn Jetelina. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: Tiny Love Stories: Now That Were Married, Whats Your Name?
description: Solitary on my postage stamp porch, I wear Chanel No. 5 and wait, a glass of ruby Beaujolais in hand. A plate with cold green grapes and fat slices of Fontina rests next to me. A soft ocean breeze touches my cheek, carrying the scent of clean salt water. I sip. I wait. I watch. Azure blue fades to delicate gold, chased by a blushing pink horizon. One year ago, I insisted again on a divorce. Now, I revel in a glorious summer sunset. Alone, complete, at peace.  Wendy Maldonado DAmico

title: Wildfires Burn Across Louisiana, Killing 2
description: Hundreds of wildfires burning across Louisiana have killed two people and burned through an estimated 60,000 acres of land, state officials said on Tuesday as they warned that the dangerously dry conditions are expected to continue.

title: Tennessee Session Ends in Chaos, With No Action on Gun Control
description: Tennessee Republicans on Tuesday ended a special session of the state legislature devoted to public safety without passing any new restrictions on firearm access, bringing to a close an emotional and chaotic week that was punctuated by tearful pleas from parents whose children survived a mass shooting at a Nashville Christian school.

title: Politicians to Shein: Not So Fast on U.S. Expansion
description: Shein, the ultrafast fashion retailer widely popular among Generation Z and millennial shoppers, faces demands from more than a dozen state attorneys general to answer questions about its business practices as the companys U.S. expansion continues.

title: The Lives Lost to the Jacksonville Gunman
description: There was the picture of Anolt Joseph Laguerre Jr., known as A.J., big as life at 18 in the red satin cap and gown hed worn in May 2022 as he walked across the stage at his graduation from William M. Raines High School.

title: Cedar Key Residents in the Path of Idalia Prepare for the Worst
description: In Cedar Key  an island city of roughly 700 people in Floridas Big Bend region  storefronts were boarded up and residents milled about on Tuesday in the slow pace singular to Floridians familiar with such storms. And yet, as the seasonal hurricane ritual started anew and city officials urged people to evacuate, locals expressed a less familiar feeling: worry.

title: How to Track a Hurricane
description: Hurricane Idalia continued to build strength over the Gulf of Mexicos abnormally warm waters on Tuesday, taking aim at a vulnerable but sparsely populated portion of Floridas coastline known as the Big Bend, where the peninsula curves west into the Panhandle.

title: How Korean Restaurants Remade Fine Dining in New York
description: A few months ago, a number of serious food journalists asked out loud whether fine dining was dying, or possibly already dead. This seemed odd to me. I keep close tabs on the restaurant scene, especially in New York City, and if expensive restaurants were undergoing a mass die-off, Id like to think I would notice. The truth, in fact, seemed to be the opposite. Fancy restaurants are opening here so quickly that there arent enough nights in the week for me to check them all out.

title: When I Tell You Nikki Haley Is Pathetic, Thats an Understatement
description: I wish it were as simple as that one Republican debate.

title: Uganda Arrests Man on Antigay Charge Punishable by Death
description: Ugandan prosecutors have lodged charges of aggravated homosexuality against a 20-year-old man  a crime punishable by death  in one of the countrys first applications of a provision included in one of the worlds harshest antigay laws.

title: Taylor Swifts Eras Tour Speed Round, Part 1
description: The first leg of Taylor Swifts Eras Tour has come to a close, with the pop superstar having performed in stadiums across North America for several million people.

title: How Might Trump Challenge the March 4 Trial Date in the Federal Election Case?
description: Former President Donald J. Trump immediately vowed to challenge the March 4 start date for his criminal trial over his efforts to overturn the 2020 election, raising questions of whether or how he could try to push back the timing of the case.

title: Former Pediatrician Ordered To Pay $22 Million in Sexual Abuse Suit
description: A Long Island judge has ordered former pediatrician Stuart Copperman to pay $22 million in compensatory and punitive damages to a 42-year-old woman who claimed he had sexually abused her from the time she was a toddler until she turned 18.

title: Two Languages Walk Into a Bar
description: I have been asked often these days about a recent study on a form of Spanish-influenced English that has emerged in Miami. It is by the linguist Phillip Carter at Florida International University, assisted by Kristen DAlessandro Merii.

title: A S.A.D. Story: What Can We Learn From the 1970s?
description: In my experience, economic pundits all too often suffer from S.A.D.  not seasonal affective disorder, a form of depression that afflicts many people during the dark winter months, but seventies analogy disorder, a propensity to react to any hint of inflation with the assertion that the stagflation of the 1970s has made a comeback.

title: After Supreme Court Forces Its Hand, E.P.A. Curbs Wetlands Protection
description: The Biden administration on Tuesday lifted protections from pollution for millions of acres of wetlands, three months after the Supreme Court found that it lacked the authority to regulate them.

title: Where Tech Investors Are Buying Up Land, Locals Are Worried
description: In a rural slice of Californias Solano County, between the cities of the Bay Area and Sacramento, rumors have been swirling for years about the Flanneries, a mystery company buying up mostly undeveloped land.

title: A California Land Mystery Is Solved. Now the Political Fight Begins.
description: Jan Sramek was 15 years old the first time he tried to get a government to do something he wanted. Back then, he was an internet- and science fiction-obsessed teenager growing up in Drevohostice, in the Czech Republic.

title: Behind the Plan to Build a California City From Scratch
description: A mysterious company has spent millions to buy land in Northern California. Heres what we know.

title: She Was Depressed and Forgetful. It Was the Worm in Her Brain.
description: Doctors in Australia had screened, scanned and tested a woman to find out why she was sick after being hospitalized with abdominal pains and diarrhea. They were not prepared for what they found.

title: Wednesday Briefing: U.S. Businesses Say China Is Uninvestable
description: Gina Raimondo, the U.S. commerce secretary, told Chinese officials yesterday that the U.S. was not seeking to sever economic ties with China. But she raised a list of concerns that were prompting American businesses to describe China as uninvestable because its too risky.

title: Offshore Wind Auction for the Gulf of Mexico Gets a Tepid Response
description: The first auction of leases for wind farms in the Gulf of Mexico, which the Biden administration had heralded as part of its effort to expand clean energy, ended on Tuesday with just one of three available tracts sold.
